full_name: UN Regulation No. 156 - Software update and software update management system

articles.title: Scope
articles.text:
1.1.

1.1.

This Regulation applies to vehicles of Categories (1) M, N, O, R, S and T that permit software updates.

This Regulation applies to vehicles of Categories (1) M, N, O, R, S and T that permit software updates.

2.6.

‘Vehicle user’ means a person operating or driving the vehicle, a vehicle owner, an authorised representative or employee of a fleet manager, an authorised representative or employee of the vehicle manufacturer, or an authorized technician.

‘Vehicle user’ means a person operating or driving the vehicle, a vehicle owner, an authorised representative or employee of a fleet manager, an authorised representative or employee of the vehicle manufacturer, or an authorized technician.

2.7.

‘Safe state’ means an operating mode in case of a failure of an item without an unreasonable level of risk.

2.8.

2.8.

‘Software’ means the part of an Electronic Control System that consists of digital data and instruction.

2.9.

‘Over-the-Air (OTA) update’ means any method of making data transfers wirelessly instead of using a cable or other local connection.

2.10.

‘System’ means a set of components and/or sub-systems that implement a function of functions.

2.11.

articles.title: Markings
articles.text:
4.1.

4.1.

There shall be affixed, conspicuously and in a readily accessible place specified on the approval form, to every vehicle conforming to a vehicle type approved under this Regulation an international approval mark consisting of:

There shall be affixed, conspicuously and in a readily accessible place specified on the approval form, to every vehicle conforming to a vehicle type approved under this Regulation an international approval mark consisting of:

4.1.1.

4.1.1.

A circle surrounding the Letter ‘E’ followed by the distinguishing number of the country which has granted approval (2).

A circle surrounding the Letter ‘E’ followed by the distinguishing number of the country which has granted approval (2).

4.1.2.

4.2.

4.2.

articles.title: Approval
articles.text:
5.1.

5.1.

Approval Authorities shall grant, as appropriate, type approval with regard to software update procedures and processes, only to such vehicle types that satisfy the requirements of this Regulation.

Approval Authorities shall grant, as appropriate, type approval with regard to software update procedures and processes, only to such vehicle types that satisfy the requirements of this Regulation.

5.1.1.

5.1.1.

The Approval Authority or the Technical Service shall verify by testing a vehicle of the vehicle type that the vehicle manufacturer has implemented the measures they have documented. Tests shall be performed by approval authority or the technical service itself or in collaboration with the vehicle manufacturer by sampling.

The Approval Authority or the Technical Service shall verify by testing a vehicle of the vehicle type that the vehicle manufacturer has implemented the measures they have documented. Tests shall be performed by approval authority or the technical service itself or in collaboration with the vehicle manufacturer by sampling.

5.2.

5.2.

Notice of approval or of extension or refusal of approval of a vehicle type pursuant to this Regulation shall be communicated to the Parties to the 1958 Agreement which apply this Regulation, by means of a form conforming to the model in Annex 2 to this Regulation.

Notice of approval or of extension or refusal of approval of a vehicle type pursuant to this Regulation shall be communicated to the Parties to the 1958 Agreement which apply this Regulation, by means of a form conforming to the model in Annex 2 to this Regulation.

5.3.

5.3.

Approval Authorities shall not grant any type approval without ensuring that the manufacturer has put in place satisfactory arrangements and procedures to manage properly the software update processes aspects as covered by this regulation.

Approval Authorities shall not grant any type approval without ensuring that the manufacturer has put in place satisfactory arrangements and procedures to manage properly the software update processes aspects as covered by this regulation.

articles.title: Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System
articles.text:
6.1.

6.1.

Contracting Parties shall appoint an Approval Authority to carry out the assessment of the manufacturer and to issue a Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System.

Contracting Parties shall appoint an Approval Authority to carry out the assessment of the manufacturer and to issue a Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System.

6.2.

6.2.

An application for a Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System shall be submitted by the vehicle manufacturer or by their duly accredited representative.

An application for a Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System shall be submitted by the vehicle manufacturer or by their duly accredited representative.

6.3.

6.3.

It shall be accompanied by the undermentioned documents in triplicate, and by the following particular:

It shall be accompanied by the undermentioned documents in triplicate, and by the following particular:

6.3.1.

6.3.1.

Documents describing the Software Update Management System.

Documents describing the Software Update Management System.

6.3.2.

6.3.2.

A signed declaration using the model as defined in Appendix 1 to Annex 1.

A signed declaration using the model as defined in Appendix 1 to Annex 1.

6.4.

6.4.

In the context of the assessment, the manufacturer shall declare using the model as defined in Appendix 1 to Annex 1 and demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Approval Authority or its Technical Service that they have the necessary processes to comply with all the requirements for software updates according to this Regulation.

In the context of the assessment, the manufacturer shall declare using the model as defined in Appendix 1 to Annex 1 and demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Approval Authority or its Technical Service that they have the necessary processes to comply with all the requirements for software updates according to this Regulation.

6.5.

6.5.

When this assessment has been satisfactorily completed and in receipt of a signed declaration from the manufacturer according to the model as defined in Appendix 1 to Annex 1, a certificate named Certificate of Compliance for SUMS as described in Annex 4 to this Regulation (hereinafter the Certificate of Compliance for SUMS) shall be granted to the manufacturer.

When this assessment has been satisfactorily completed and in receipt of a signed declaration from the manufacturer according to the model as defined in Appendix 1 to Annex 1, a certificate named Certificate of Compliance for SUMS as described in Annex 4 to this Regulation (hereinafter the Certificate of Compliance for SUMS) shall be granted to the manufacturer.

6.6.

6.6.

The Certificate of Compliance for SUMS shall remain valid for a maximum of three years from the date of deliverance of the certificate unless it is withdrawn.

The Certificate of Compliance for SUMS shall remain valid for a maximum of three years from the date of deliverance of the certificate unless it is withdrawn.

6.7.

6.7.

The Approval Authority which has granted the Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System may at any time verify its continued compliance. The Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System may be withdrawn if the requirements laid down in this Regulation are no longer met.

The Approval Authority which has granted the Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System may at any time verify its continued compliance. The Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System may be withdrawn if the requirements laid down in this Regulation are no longer met.

6.8.

6.8.

The manufacturer shall inform the Approval Authority or its Technical Service of any change that will affect the relevance of the Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System. After consultation with the manufacturer, the Approval Authority or its Technical Service shall decide whether new checks are necessary.

The manufacturer shall inform the Approval Authority or its Technical Service of any change that will affect the relevance of the Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System. After consultation with the manufacturer, the Approval Authority or its Technical Service shall decide whether new checks are necessary.

6.9.

6.9.

At the end of the period of validity of the Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System, the Approval Authority shall, after a positive assessment, issue a new Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System or extends its validity for a further period of three years. The Approval Authority shall issue a new certificate in cases where changes have been brought to the attention of the Approval Authority or its Technical Service and the changes have been positively re-assessed.

At the end of the period of validity of the Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System, the Approval Authority shall, after a positive assessment, issue a new Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System or extends its validity for a further period of three years. The Approval Authority shall issue a new certificate in cases where changes have been brought to the attention of the Approval Authority or its Technical Service and the changes have been positively re-assessed.

6.10.

6.10.

Existing vehicle type approvals shall not lose their validity due to the expiration of the manufacturer’s Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System.

Existing vehicle type approvals shall not lose their validity due to the expiration of the manufacturer’s Certificate of Compliance for Software Update Management System.

7.2.1.2.1.

Each RXSWIN shall be uniquely identifiable. When type approval relevant software is modified by the vehicle manufacturer, the RXSWIN shall be updated if it leads to a type approval extension or to a new type approval.

7.2.1.2.2.

Each RXSWIN shall be easily readable in a standardized way via the use of an electronic communication interface, at least by the standard interface (OBD port).

7.2.1.2.3.

7.2.2.1.

7.2.2.1.1.

The vehicle manufacturer shall ensure that the vehicle is able to restore systems to their previous version in case of a failed or interrupted update or that the vehicle can be placed into a safe state after a failed or interrupted update.

7.2.2.1.3.

7.2.2.1.3.

When the execution of an update may affect the safety of the vehicle, the vehicle manufacturer shall demonstrate how the update will be executed safely. This shall be achieved through technical means that ensures the vehicle is in a state where the update can be executed safely.

articles.text:

articles.title: Conformity of production
articles.text:
9.1.

9.1.

The Conformity of Production Procedures shall comply with those set out in the 1958 Agreement, Schedule 1 (E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.3) with the following requirements:

The Conformity of Production Procedures shall comply with those set out in the 1958 Agreement, Schedule 1 (E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.3) with the following requirements:

9.1.1.

9.1.1.

The holder of the approval shall ensure that results of the conformity of production tests are recorded and that the annexed documents remain available for a period determined in agreement with the Approval Authority or its Technical Service. This period shall not exceed 10 years counted from the time when production is definitively discontinued;

The holder of the approval shall ensure that results of the conformity of production tests are recorded and that the annexed documents remain available for a period determined in agreement with the Approval Authority or its Technical Service. This period shall not exceed 10 years counted from the time when production is definitively discontinued;

9.1.2.

9.1.2.

The Approval Authority which has granted type approval may at any time verify the conformity control methods applied in each production facility. The normal frequency of these verifications shall be once every three years.

The Approval Authority which has granted type approval may at any time verify the conformity control methods applied in each production facility. The normal frequency of these verifications shall be once every three years.

9.1.3.

9.1.3.

The Approval Authority or its Technical Service shall periodically validate that the processes used and decisions made by the vehicle manufacturer are compliant, particularly for instances where the vehicle manufacturer chose not to notify the Approval Authority or its Technical Service about an update. This may be achieved on a sampling basis.

articles.title: Penalties for non-conformity of production
articles.text:
10.1.

10.1.

The approval granted in respect of a vehicle type pursuant to this Regulation may be withdrawn if the requirement laid down in this Regulation are not complied with or if sample vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of this Regulation.

The approval granted in respect of a vehicle type pursuant to this Regulation may be withdrawn if the requirement laid down in this Regulation are not complied with or if sample vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of this Regulation.

10.2.

10.2.

If an Approval Authority withdraws an approval it has previously granted, it shall forthwith so notify the Contracting Parties applying this Regulation, by means of a communication form conforming to the model in Annex 2 to this Regulation.

If an Approval Authority withdraws an approval it has previously granted, it shall forthwith so notify the Contracting Parties applying this Regulation, by means of a communication form conforming to the model in Annex 2 to this Regulation.

articles.title: Production definitively discontinued
articles.text:
11.1.

11.1.

If the holder of the approval completely ceases to manufacture a type of vehicle approved in accordance with this Regulation, he shall so inform the authority which granted the approval. Upon receiving the relevant communication that authority shall inform thereof the other Contracting Parties to the Agreement applying this Regulation by means of a copy of the approval form bearing at the end, in large letters, the signed and dated annotation ‘PRODUCTION DISCONTINUED’.

If the holder of the approval completely ceases to manufacture a type of vehicle approved in accordance with this Regulation, he shall so inform the authority which granted the approval. Upon receiving the relevant communication that authority shall inform thereof the other Contracting Parties to the Agreement applying this Regulation by means of a copy of the approval form bearing at the end, in large letters, the signed and dated annotation ‘PRODUCTION DISCONTINUED’.

articles.title: Names and addresses of Technical Services responsible for conducting approval tests, and of Type Approval Authorities
articles.text:

12.1.

The Contracting Parties to the Agreement which apply this Regulation shall communicate to the United Nations Secretariat the names and addresses of the Technical Services responsible for conducting approval tests and of the Type Approval Authorities which grant approval and to which forms certifying approval or extension or refusal or withdrawal of approval, issued in other countries, are to be sent.
